qas.question: Who focused on identifying stimuli that can influence learning?
Who also along with Dunn recommended other teaching studies?
Who discredited identifying stimuli that can influence learning?
Who also along with Dunn discouraged other teaching studies?
Who disagreed with the Type Delineator?
Whose work was the Keirsey Temperament Sorter not based on?
Who did not recommend varying strategies?

context: <a0_0><b3_0>Dunn<a0_0/> and Dunn<b3_0/> focused on identifying relevant stimuli that may influence learning and manipulating the school environment, at about the same time as <a1_0><b4_0><b7_0>Joseph Renzulli<b7_0/><b4_0/><a1_0/> recommended varying teaching strategies. Howard Gardner identified a wide range of modalities in his Multiple Intelligences theories. The Myers-Briggs Type Indicator and Keirsey Temperament Sorter, based on <b6_0>the works of Jung<b6_0/>, focus on understanding how people's personality affects the way they interact personally, and how this affects the way individuals respond to each other within the learning environment. The work of <a2_0><b5_0>David Kolb and Anthony Gregorc's<b5_0/><a2_0/> Type Delineator follows a similar but more simplified approach.
